alert.note: Alert for Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 11:24PM MST until February 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches, except up to 20 inches above 9,500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become very slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will create poor visibility at times, including near white-out conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
